body_html:
I have a similar issue with Reinforcement Learning. I am using the discrete_deepe.py from nivwusquorum https://github.com/nivwusquorum/tensorflow-deepq/tree/master/tf_rl/controller.

I have a dataset with about 50,000 samples and each observation is about 80 points. This takes about 10 Mins per iteration to processes which seems pretty slow. I have a GPU and haven't check to see if the individual observations are being computed in that or the CPU.

body:
I have a similar issue with Reinforcement Learning.  I am using the discrete_deepe.py from nivwusquorum [https://github.com/nivwusquorum/tensorflow-deepq/tree/master/tf_rl/controller](url).

I have a dataset with about 50,000 samples and each observation is about 80 points.  This takes about 10 Mins per iteration to processes which seems pretty slow.  I have a GPU and haven't check to see if the individual observations are being computed in that or the CPU.
